message.content:
The main verb tenses in English include:
1. Present Simple - used for habits, routines and general truths. (e.g., "I eat breakfast every morning.")
2. Past Simple - used to describe completed actions or events that happened at a specific time in the past. (e.g., "Yesterday, I went shopping.")
3. Present Continuous - used for ongoing actions or situations happening now. (e.g., "Right now, I am cooking dinner.")
4. Past Continuous - used to describe an action that was occurring at a specific time in the past and may have been interrupted by another event. (e.g., "While I was studying last night, my roommate came home.")
5. Present Perfect - used for actions completed at an unspecified time before now or for emphasizing the result of an action rather than the action itself. (e.g., "I have finished my homework.")
6. Past Perfect - used to describe a past event that happened before another specified past event. (e.g., "Before I went to bed, I had already done my homework.")
7. Future Simple - used for predictions or plans about future events. (e.g., "Tomorrow, I will go shopping.")
8. Future Continuous - used for actions that are planned and expected to be ongoing in the future. (e.g., "Next week, I will be working on my project.")
9. Future Perfect - used to describe an action completed at some point in the future before another specified event or time. (e.g., "By next year, I will have finished college.")
10. Future Perfect Continuous - used for actions that are planned and expected to be ongoing up until a specific point in the future. (e.g., "In two months, I will have been working at this job for six years.")
